column1: #TeamBaltimore secured over $654K for @JohnsHopkins through the @NIH to research  + address coronavirus testing health disparities among women suffering from substance use disorders esp. as we continue to fight COVID-19. More:https://t.co/IIlqhTXAj4

Joining @HoCoGovExec @HudsonCoastal in Fulton at 11:30 this AM as he announces additional biz grants provided under the federal CARES Act. We URGENTLY need another round of #COVID19 relief that is bigger + better.

#COVID19 infection rates among #MD’s Latino communities are relatively higher than any other racial or ethnic population in our state. #TeamMaryland is urging @GovLarryHogan to slow the spread + provide targeted relief to Latinx families. Read our letter: https://t.co/23oDx8ubbA

#TeamMaryland just announced @JohnsHopkins will receive over $8.3M from the @NIH to bolster its #COVID19 testing and response programs to better meet the needs of underserved populations and minority communities. Read the breakdown of the grant here: https://t.co/5zErdXuHim

Wishing the President and First Lady a speedy recovery. #COVID19 is a powerful virus to which not even the President is immune. We must remain vigilant: wear a mask practice physical distance and avoid large gatherings.

Yesterday the House passed #bipartisan legislation that I helped draft after last year's ransomware attack in #Baltimore. State and local governments have been rich targets for cyber hackers for years but #COVID19 has made it worse. This bill will help. https://t.co/kHU7gsFJYg

The updated #HeroesAct makes good on @HouseDemocrats’ pledge to compromise while  addressing the health + economic crisis of #COVID19. @SenateGOP must finally negotiate + pass a bill that protects our heroes crushes the coronavirus + puts money in Americans' pockets. https://t.co/mLzT7zl9j0
Sharing on behalf of a #Baltimore company working toward a COVID-19 vaccine that is looking to fill hundreds of job openings. https://t.co/Am0fmYp9dO

200000 coronavirus deaths. Each victim someone’s mother father child grandparent teacher friend or physician. It didn’t have to be this bad. @POTUS knew COVID-19 was ‘deadly stuff’ yet deliberately downplayed its severity.  My full statement: https://t.co/r2ulkhYeHo https://t.co/qVoDClcV7n

The #COVID19 pandemic has made recovery even more difficult for those who are struggling. This #RecoveryMonth I’m wearing purple to show my support for those with substance use disorders. https://t.co/ryextd9uzL
#TeamMaryland just announced $20M+ in emergency federal funding to support @MedStarHealth's #Covid_19 response. More: https://t.co/8dNvnm71aj

Proud to introduce my new bill today the Dr. Joseph J. Costa HEARTS Act named after Dr. Joseph Costa who ran the @MdMercyBalt critical care unit + treated #COVID patients before dying from the disease himself in July. More: https://t.co/31mMjAmDaZ https://t.co/bZzftoiZ1r

Tune in below to watch my press conference at #Baltimore’s @MdMercyBalt live at 1pm today where I’ll be unveiling my new bill – the Dr. Joseph J. Costa HEARTS Act – which provides “hero” pay to hospital workers on the #COVID19 frontlines. https://t.co/fkuxvcW9H9

#TeamMaryland has not taken our eye off the ball when it comes to fighting the #opioidcrisis. If anything #Covid_19 has only made it harder to access treatment + recovery services. Today we announced $50M to support @MDHealthDept's statewide efforts: https://t.co/l5ZZ5dqljf

Small businesses both in #Maryland and across the country are the engine of our economy. Pleased to announce $3.4M in federal #CARESAct funding to support small businesses in #MD02 and our state as we continue to weather the #COVID19 storm. More: https://t.co/KKVhf5hqbK
If the President and his staff will continue getting tested for #COVID19 despite being asymptomatic so should the rest of the country. Not only is the @CDC’s new ruling absurd it is dangerous.

Students in #MD + across the country are going hungry during the #COVID19 crisis. That’s why we’re calling on @USDA leadership to extend school nutrition waivers for the 20/21 school year to ensure children have access to healthy meals. Read our letter: https://t.co/MkxrZekU4v

The House and Senate each have different proposals for the next COVID-relief bill. The House has put fort the #HEROESAct while the Senate has introduced the #HEALSAct. Which do you prefer? https://t.co/HscKTrm3U5

Helped pass today's six-bill “minibus” appropriations package that supports #MD’s military + #ChesapeakeBay-focused economies provides a 3% pay raise for troops funds key police reforms + authorizes emergency spending on #COVID19 vaccines + drugs. More:https://t.co/eyStdNeQMJ

COVID-19 has devastated the child care sector forcing closures + exacerbating the shortage of quality affordable care. I'm proud to support two bills to provide relief for families + providers + support the safe reopening of our economy. #SaveChildCare https://t.co/a1oOUtoyqm
#TeamBaltimore just announced almost $425000 in federal funding from @NIAIDNews to support @UMBaltimore’s extensive #COVID19 research. More about the grant here: https://t.co/AKdDWLJhGH

.@HouseDemocrats voted to renew an extra $600/week for those unable to work due to COVID-19 as part of the #HeroesAct 2 months ago. These benefits will expire at the end of July if @senatemajldr McConnell doesn't act swiftly. Read my @baltimoresun op-ed: https://t.co/LlIWvPBe7b

Last week we saw the largest single day increase in new US #COVID19 infections (67000+). The pandemic is not over. I’m calling on @HHSgov to extend the public health emergency expiring 7/25 to help states like #MD continue receiving federal funding. https://t.co/88ntiazYWI

47794 Americans have lost their lives to #COVID19 in the two months since @HouseDemocrats passed the #HeroesAct. It’s shameful that the Senate is dragging its feet on this critical legislation that gives American communities the tools to fight this crisis. https://t.co/NpMHuxCFug

This is yet another transparent attempt by the Trump Administration to undermine the @CDCgov's #COVID19 response and potentially politicize pandemic data in the US. We simply cannot allow this to happen. https://t.co/iZDA5Kll6b

Unsure of your paid sick leave safe workplaces and lawful pay rights during the COVID-19 pandemic? The @USDOL's Wage and Hour Division launched a public awareness campaign to address just this. Get the info you need here: https://t.co/PhskiBw9sH

Just sent @fema leadership a letter calling for them to approve #Maryland’s request for federal disaster assistance to help our state manage ongoing COVID-19 recovery efforts + prepare for future emergencies. Read #TeamMaryland’s letter here: https://t.co/TlOwJY0Yzi

With all the work we have to do at home to end systemic racism and racial injustice while continuing to stem the tide of the coronavirus pandemic I want to acknowledge the soldiers that selflessly serve us on the front lines. Happy birthday @USArmy! https://t.co/SCbUVdicmg

Proud to join MD Attorney General @BrianFrosh's COVID-19 Access to Justice Taskforce to ensure #Marylanders who need help with civil conflicts during this time won’t just receive legal advice but will experience a fair + equitable justice system. More: https://t.co/agq8N2upoO

Pleased to join the full #Maryland Congressional delegation in announcing over $2.3M in @HUDgov funding for renters + homeowners across our state who are struggling financially because of #COVID_19. Read the full list of the grant recipients here: https://t.co/WVQooUHdbk

Joined #TeamMaryland today in announcing $18M+ to alleviate the costs of @umms' ongoing #COVID19 response inclu. statewide disinfection procedures distributing PPE + providing medical services to #Marylanders. Learn more here: https://t.co/dVD2suWDT8

Entire #TeamMaryland came together in announcing $35M in #COVID19 @HUDgov relief grants for homeless Marylanders or Marylanders at risk of homelessness as a result of the pandemic. This is on top of more than $15M for this purpose announced in March. More: https://t.co/vyP26YH7sz

In times of crisis we show what we’re made of. I am so proud of #TeamDutch’s grit and results over the last 12 weeks as we help #MD02 navigate the unchartered waters #COVID-19. Take a look. https://t.co/I1iDUDjDWt
#TeamMaryland is asking Governor Hogan to publicly release #MD's #COVID19 testing plan… https://t.co/zRNvEDMsuo

Pleased to help secure $1 million in funding from the @FCC  for @HopkinsMedicine to ramp up #COVID19 telehealth services and develop a remote intensive care unit to ensure ALL #Baltimore’s communities have equal access to health care. More here: https://t.co/LF6nJ7oaPb

The #coronavirus has disproportionately affected #MD’s communities of color. That’s why #TeamMaryland + I sent a letter to @GovLarryHogan urging him to expand testing + use race + ethnicity data to develop a comprehensive plan to address this. More: https://t.co/r02hXte14R

Got a question about your #Covid_19 stimulus check? Call the new @IRSnews hotline or my office if you’re in #MD02. Lawmakers now have a direct inquiry line for constituents – and I’m taking credit since I just sent a letter to @USTreasury asking for tools to get status updates. https://t.co/fQp3XOqWBN

Spent time this afternoon learning more about @emergentbiosolu’s work to manufacture a #COVID__19 vaccine right here in #Baltimore. They are helping to put #Maryland on the map in the race to fight end this pandemic and we are rooting them on. https://t.co/pmKkoOYhe3

The #HeroesAct reflects the aggressive response demanded by the worst public health threat in our lifetime. Funds testing a second round of stimulus checks for families + helps our state and county workers on the frontlines of the #COVID19 fight. More: https://t.co/erKJ5Dy9ys
Joined #TeamBaltimore in announcing over $160k in #CARESAct and @NSF funding for @JohnsHopkins to continue conducting critical research on effective #COVID19 treatments. More: https://t.co/bjPKu6ojNI

Fantastic news! Proud to announce – along with the #Maryland Congressional delegation – that our state has received over $205M from @HHSGov to drastically ramp up #COVID19 testing for #Marylanders statewide. More: https://t.co/VVOZd3d8Bq

I'm supporting the #HeroesAct introduced by @HouseDemocrats. As a former #Baltimore County Exec I am very concerned about the frontline workers at the local levels - our teachers firefighters police officers healthcare workers. They can't fight the #coronavirus pandemic alone https://t.co/mOxwGjKsw8

Just sent letter to @USTreasury because we STILL don't have a way for @IRSnews to check the status of #Covid_19  stimulus checks. That we remain unable to provide timely answers to basic questions from anxious constituents is no longer acceptable. More: https://t.co/fklo92woDi

#MD's seafood industry – predominantly comprised of small + family-owned businesses – has been hit hard by the #coronavirus. Proud to help secure $4.1M in much-needed relief funding from @CommerceGov + @NOAA to aid #Marylanders weathering this storm. More:https://t.co/ALpsI9cKPN

More good news for our state. Joined #TeamMaryland in announcing $16M+ in federal funding for @MDHousing to protect people facing homelessness + low-income renters struggling because of #COVID19. More about the Community Development Block Grant here: https://t.co/2bSLSraamB

Joined my #TeamMaryland colleagues in announcing another $1.5 million for healthcare providers in #Maryland to expand telehealth services to continue offering safe and high-quality care to patients amid #Covid_19. More: https://t.co/Xs7YJjn6Xj

Joined #TeamMaryland in announcing $17M+ in @NationalService funding for @AmeriCorps enabling the national service program to place over 1200 volunteers into 10 organizations statewide + continue their crucial work in #MD while we combat #COVID19. More:https://t.co/j3OyTWH99j

Along w/ #TeamMaryland I'm calling on @TheJusticeDept to take further action to slow the spread of #coronavirus in federal prisons by ensuring staff are provided w/ adequate PPE regular testing + health care support. Read our letter here: https://t.co/3P3DiwMImW

Proud to lead a bipartisan effort w/ @RepSteveStivers to encourage leadership at the @USTreasury @federalreserve to help our state + local governments provide critical services as they face unprecedented challenges due to #COVID19. Read our letter here:https://t.co/9cg3mgBJJl

First virtual press conference w/ @SenatorCardin @ChrisVanHollen @Mfume4Congress @mayorbcyoung @RepSarbanes @HoCoGovExec @AACoExec and on an extremely imp topic - helping states + cities weather #COVIDー19. https://t.co/XDmRe2KKla

Tomorrow the @BlueAngels and @AFThunderbirds will be flying over #Baltimore in honor of healthcare workers and first responders on the frontlines of our fight against #COVID19. Check out the attached graphic for the flight route. #AmericaStrong https://t.co/gOkzKxjZJE
Thanks to @MDHealthDept @MDMEMA for a productive call w/ #TeamMaryland on #COVID__19 testing - key to saving lives + livelihoods. More:  https://t.co/mGHFE7irp5

Joined @SenatorCardin @ChrisVanHollen + @RepSarbanes in announcing $200k in #CARESAct @NSF funding for @JohnsHopkins to manage + update its online #coronavirus tracker which provides accurate real-time data + expert analysis to the world. More: https://t.co/IbVc2vNKm0

#MD has approx. 500k #COVID_19 test kit components but we need help boosting processing capabilities so our state’s recovery plan works. That’s why I joined the Team Maryland in urging the President to open federally supported labs in our region. More: https://t.co/8ZC7QDXKm7

Joined my #TeamMaryland colleagues in calling on @CMSGov leadership to immediately release #CARESAct funds to support efforts preventing devastating #COVID_19 outbreaks in nursing homes nationwide. Read our letter here: https://t.co/ZJ9N58aqDT

Proud to join @SenatorCardin @BaltCoPS Debbie Phelps @Ravens @Mandrews_81 + many others in supporting the @wbaltv11 @wbalradio @98Rock virtual food drive for the @MDFoodBank + thousands of hungry #Marylanders during the #COVID-19 pandemic. Check it out! https://t.co/jh2ZfUg204

Helped secure over $422K in CARES Act funding for @MDLegalAid to provide legal services to low-income #Marylanders confronting legal issues exacerbated by #COVID_19 – ranging from job losses + senior scams to evictions + domestic violence. More:
And for the record yes I wore my homemade @Ravens #COVIDー19 face mask on the House floor to vote. #RavensFlock #Baltimore https://t.co/1OSMI2RK25

Just helped pass #bipartisan #COVIDー19  bill to fund small business relief help hospitals buy supplies  and expand testing which is key to re-opening our economy. It was our 4 bill responding to the pandemic and it won't be the last. More: https://t.co/EnDFmZY1vt
#MD02 constituents check out the below graphic for your direct county hotline for #coronavirus resources and assistance. https://t.co/0VE4lG68eb

Asking @realdonaldtrump + @GM leadership incl @mtbarra to re-open White Marsh plant in #MD02 to fulfill company’s federal contract to make ventilators. We can fight #Covid_19 and provide jobs for our region’s ready-to-go workforce!  #winwin Read more: https://t.co/Voi9CxZ1Ss

As co-chair of the #bipartisan House Egyptian Caucus I want to thank Egypt and its people for its generous donation of nearly 8 tons of desperately-needed PPE as we combat t#COVIDー19 especially as they are amid their own fight against the same outbreak... https://t.co/N5MPuYZkpT

Actions speak louder than words @realdonaldtrump. I will sleep better knowing #Maryland now has 500K #COVIDー19 tests from South Korea thanks to the leadership of our governor @GovLarryHogan and our First Lady.
Sharing on behalf of @UMmedschool which is looking for volunteers to participate in a remote study on a potential #COVID_19 treatment. See the flyer if interested. https://t.co/9PtUmSepnJ

#TeamMaryland just announced over $1.6M in federal funding from @USDOL to create disaster relief jobs in certain front-line industries statewide for #Marylanders who have been laid off furloughed or had their hours cut as a result of #coronavirus. More: https://t.co/utuMj5Kc5O
About to talk w/ @C4Show @wbalradio about #COVIDー19 and the federal response. Are we ready to re-open? No.

Ready to comply w/ ⁦@GovLarryHogan⁩’s order that all Marylanders wear a mask while in stores or on public transit — and show my ⁦⁦@Ravens⁩ #baltimore pride while I’m at it! Let’s all do our part and get through #Covid_19 together. https://t.co/RO8Cd2msHX

#TeamMaryland announced $45+ million from #CARESAct to support @MdPublicSchools + higher ed plan for distance learning including purchasing the technology needed for all students to continue their education throughout the #Covid_19 pandemic. More: https://t.co/hARtiDTNnd
#MD02 constituents unsure where to turn for local #coronavirus resources? Check out the below graphic for the hotline for your county. https://t.co/Vfsf4yqbwW

The @USTreasury has begun making automatic #coronavirus stimulus rebates to eligible Americans + has launched an online portal to allow individuals who don’t usually file a tax return like #SocialSecurity beneficiaries  register quickly + easily.https://t.co/dBg9WN950V

Thank you to child care providers who make it possible for other essential workers with kids to continue serving our nation during the #coronavirus crisis. I’m grateful for all you do for American families. https://t.co/TFTYnQjTbK

Thrilled to announce #MD hospitals + health care providers will receive over $742M in federal funding through the #CARESAct ensuring ALL our state’s health care providers have the necessary resources to continue to combat #coronavirus + save lives. More: https://t.co/yPGXku6Rwa
Thank you those working tirelessly to keep our essential buildings clean. Your efforts are critical to our fight against the #coronavirus. https://t.co/81pywonlFi

Another $3.8M flowing to #Maryland for #coronavirus #COVID19 response provided in #CARESAct + supported by state's entire Congressional delegation. This funding is earmarked for virus surveillance epidemiology lab capacity infection control etc. More: https://t.co/Ofxn88mwpN

Added my name to a letter urging @DHSgov to immediately cease ongoing wall construction at the southern border which blatantly defies @CDCgov’s #coronavirus guidelines + jeopardizes law enforcement personnel workers + local border residents.

Proud to help secure another $6.4M w/ @ChrisVanHollen @SenatorCardin + the #TeamMaryland delegation to support #Maryland’s #coronavirus response. The federal funding comes on top of $10.2M already announced with more to come. More: https://t.co/9hlTq2b4XR

Thank you to our essential retail workers for keeping shelves stocked with essential goods and services during and protecting vulnerable groups by implementing designated shopping hours the #coronavirus pandemic. https://t.co/XMfkUXznjr

Just added my name to a letter calling on @HHSGov to immediately begin distributing life-saving funding to hospitals nationwide. The $100bn in aid provided through the #CARESAct will support hospitals and health care workers on the frontlines of the #coronavirus.

Today I say a special thank-you to our police firefighters and emergency medical services personnel for continuing to serve our communities tirelessly during this #coronavirus emergency. https://t.co/NTnuL6fcZJ

Added my name to a letter urging @US_FDA to immediately review a pending design for a ventilator made by @UMNews  that can be mass-produced cheaper and quicker. We can’t afford to wait any longer. #coronavirus

I am always thankful for our health care workers but I am especially grateful for their dedicated and selfless efforts on the front lines of the #coronavirus pandemic to keep us healthy. https://t.co/nEPlEOR9vi

Masks. Face shields. Ventilators. These are the tools our health care workers need to take on the coronavirus. Resources secured by Democrats in the relief package will help them access the tools and more. #FamiliesFirst https://t.co/IuwSIWVCp0

A message to our front-line and behind-the-scenes workers who are the unsung heroes of the #Covid_19 #coronavirus pandemic. On behalf of #MD02 THANK YOU to the men and women who are keeping us safe and helping us to maintain some sense of normalcy during these challenging times. https://t.co/Qkyolgdyls

I was able to play a small role of match-maker as #Maryland's @asrcfederaljobs donated 500+ bottles of hand sanitizer from cancelled trade show to @baltimorepolice. THANKS to ALL first responders + good corporate citizens for helping to fight #COVID19  together! w/ @mayorbcyoung https://t.co/6ECLSMiZ9F
About to talk #coronavirus #COVID19 #familiesfirst aid package w/ @wbalradio @C4Show. Tune in.

#MD02 constituents - I am updating my #coronavirus #Covid_19 webpage multiple times a day. Lots of resources + info on closures unemployment paid leave small biz help and more. https://t.co/szFsprDYZn

Congressionally-approved federal #coronavirus funds are reaching #Maryland. Nearly $1.2 million so far for 17 local health clinics SO FAR. This will make a real difference in our ability to treat sick people right here in our community. https://t.co/Pt21A04ton

Enough w/ the finger-pointing. The reality is that leadership from BOTH parties in BOTH chambers are working around the clock w/ the Administration to strike a deal. When we are preparing to spend $2 trillion we need to get it right. Expecting a deal today. #coronavirus

Just signed my name to bill directing @realdonaldtrump to fully activate his authority to nationalize our medical supply chain. Hospitals are in desperate need of respirators ventilators face masks gloves gowns and more. It’s WAY past time to do this. #coronavirus #COVIDー19

Starting to hear from constituents overwhelmed by #coronavirus #COVIDー19 stress + anxiety. If you need help coping please call the @CDCgov Disaster Distress Helpline at 1-800-985-5990 or text TALKWITHUS to 66746. If you feel like you may harm yourself call 911 now.
#coronavirus update from @USTreasury: deadline for filing taxes also extended to July 15 2020.

.@SBAgov has approved Maryland's request for disaster declaration. We're all working together at the county state and federal levels to ensure Maryland gets the resources it needs to respond to #Covid_19  #coronavirus pandemic. #TeamMaryland. More: https://t.co/Pq98qQDiMH

#TeamMaryland inc @ChrisVanHollen @SenatorCardin @RepSarbanes @RepAnthonyBrown @RepDavidTrone @RepAndyHarrisMD @RepRaskin @LeaderHoyer is urging @SBAgov to approve @GovLarryHogan's #Maryland's request for #Coronavirus disaster declaration More: https://t.co/ASBraJnR9I

Just joined another effort to make sure any upcoming #Covid_19 #coronavirus aid packages require @usedgov to automatically place student loans into forbearance or deferment following the administration’s announcement last week that student loan interest would be suspended.

#Coronavirus update from @USTreasury @IRSnews: Americans owing up to $1M in federal income tax and businesses owing up to $10M now have additional 90 days (until July 15) to make their tax payments without penalty or interest. April 15 filing deadline remains.

Requesting mandatory telework on behalf of tens of thousands of patriotic federal employees in #MD02 + #Maryland. Will help slow #coronavirus spread and maintain continuity of services across the country. Also working to ensure our contractors are reimbursed for any assoc. loss https://t.co/xA4wf90YwJ
American families – not Wall Street -- need cash now. Economists agree it’s time to consider direct and immediate payments to middle class Americans. Nothing should be off the table. #Coronavirus

Just joined a letter asking the country’s largest mortgage lenders to halt all foreclosure proceedings until the #Covid_19 crisis has passed. Also urging major credit reporting agencies to stop rating missed medical bills rent as well as late credit card and mortgage payments.

Joining #TeamMaryland colleagues @SenatorCardin @ChrisVanHollen @LeaderHoyer @RepSarbanes @RepAndyHarrisMD @RepDavidTrone @RepAnthonyBrown @RepRaskin in announcing $10.2M in fed funds for Maryland's #coronavirus response . More expected. Info here: https://t.co/ELNCnlYWBY

As part of the #COVID19 response @MarylandConnect is opening an emergency enrollment from March 16th until April 15th for uninsured #Marylanders. It’s vital that we all have access to quality health coverage in order to keep our state safe. Learn more below. https://t.co/yRY81j2zFL

Checked in w/ @CDCgov Director Dr. Robert Ray Redfield Jr. and expressed concerns about high-risk #MD02 residents and the availability of testing kits. I will continue to be proactive in addressing the #COVID19 pandemic. https://t.co/UvmCLZ9Hj6
In light of the coronavirus the @BaltCoGov Department of Health has opened a hotline for residents to call with questions or concerns which can be reached at 410-887-3816.
We’re reminding our #DC office visitors of some coronavirus safety precautions – #Baltimore style! https://t.co/gWjk2YO3hn

#TeamMaryland incl @SenatorCardin  @ChrisVanHollen @LeaderHoyer @RepSarbanes @RepAndyHarrisMD @RepDavidTrone @RepRaskin on the line w/ @MDHealthDept Sec Neall getting the latest on #coronavirus. So important to communicate and plan together on the federal state and local levels. https://t.co/ha4B1AAXEw

Proud #TeamMaryland has secured an initial $500k to help #MD respond to #COVID19. The @HHSGov @CDCgov funding will support ongoing efforts to assess + monitor possible cases to keep #Marylanders safe. Additional aid to come. More: https://t.co/gjTnGXmag1

Americans need a fully-funded coordinated government-wide response to stay safe against the #coronavirus. @HouseDemocrats’ $8.3 billion emergency response package delivers the resources needed to address this public health emergency & protect the American people. #COVID19 https://t.co/lph0DaucBS

Thanks to @wbaltv11 for having me on today to discuss Congress' #coronavirus response. Safety is our highest priority which is why the House and Senate have agreed on $8.3BN in new funding that we hope to have on the President’s desk by the end of the week. https://t.co/U02VZNvph7

Although the risk for the #coronavirus breaking out in the US is currently low it’s critical we unite as Americans to provide public health experts + medical professionals w/ the resources necessary to combat this global pandemic.  More: https://t.co/A7OUf0DPWF

As the number of #coronavirus cases grow it’s crucial that we take precautions – both abroad and at home. Watch the @CDCgov’s video and refer to their website to learn more about this illness and how to protect yourself. https://t.co/KUjJH99AaC
